column5: Hi,  I am heading out to the Bay of Quinte next weekend for the first time to try for some walleye with my brother in-law. I just read the regulations but am confused, does anyone know if it is 1 or 2 rods per angler in the Bay?
One per angler for most of the Bay...two once you go past the Glenora Ferry.
Its 2 rods East of the Glenora Ferry Crossing  Out to Lake Ontario Good luck man. Let us know how you do.
The two rods only applies if you are on the water as well. So if you are shore fishing past the ferry it is still one rod. Or so that is what I understand.
on the ice two everywhere there  I am just saying  LOL
Wow that comment made hope winter is here sooner than later.
LOL...can't wait to give those BIG GOLDEN MAMMA's a shot through the ice again this year, not too mention some of those Simcoe lakers!!!!
Thanks guys, we'll be in Hay Bay for the most part so now we know 1 rod each. Looking forward to it, haven't fished for walleye in a few years. Will put up a report upon my return.
Same here man! It's going to be another AWESOME ice season! You coming out with us again?
